Package cpsc2150.extendedCheckers.models

Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard
public interface ICheckerBoard
ICheckerBoard interface for checkerboard operations getViableDirections, getPieceCounts, placePiece, whatsAtPos, checkPlayerWin, crownPiece, movePiece, jumpPiece, scanSurroundingPositions, getDirection. Checkerboard is used to store and change data within the board.

  • Method Details

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character,ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      Standard getter for viableDirections
      Returns:
      viableDirections, stores directions a piece may move, a HashMap

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character,Integer> getPieceCounts()
      Standard getter for pieceCount
      Returns:
      pieceCounts, tracks the number of pieces a player has, a HashMap

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      A mutator for the board 2D array. Used for setting a given 2D index within the board 2D array, given by the row and col of the parameter BoardPosition, equal to the char given by player
      Parameters:
      pos - The position given, an object of class BoardPosition
      player - the symbol representing a player, a char

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      An accessor for the board 2D array. Given a row and column from the BoardPosition parameter, it returns the position accordingly.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position the function is checking, an object of class BoardPosition
      Returns:
      atPos, what is at the position given by the row and col of the BoardPosition parameter, a char

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      A method that returns true or false, if a player has won the game or not. This is determined by whether all of the remaining pieces on the board belong to the player.
      Parameters:
      player - A player in checkers, an object of class Character
      Returns:
      true if there is only pieces of one player on the board, false otherwise

    • crownPiece

      default void crownPiece(BoardPosition posOfPlayer)
      A method that "crowns" a piece by converting the char at the position on the board, given by the posOfPlayer parameter, to an uppercase equivalent of the char
      Parameters:
      posOfPlayer - The position of a piece of a player, an object of class BoardPosition

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      A method which moves a piece on the board, located at the startingPos index, in the direction designated by the DirectionEnum dir
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The starting position of a piece, an object of class BoardPosition
      dir - The direction a piece should be moved, an object of class DirectionEnum
      Returns:
      piecePos, an object of class BoardPosition

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      A method that moves a piece by "jumping" the player's opponent's piece. When a player "jumps" an opponent, that player should move two positions in the direction passed in by dir parameter. The opponent's jumped piece will be removed from play.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The starting position of a piece, an object of class BoardPosition
      dir - The direction a piece should be moved, an object of class DirectionEnum
      Returns:
      piecePos, an object of class BoardPosition

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum,Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      A method which "scans" the indices surrounding the index given by the startingPos parameter
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The position from which the function scans, an object of class BoardPosition
      Returns:
      surroundingPos, maps the four DirectionEnums to the char located at that position in the respective direction, a HashMap

    • makeBoard

      static CheckerBoard makeBoard()
      A method that calls the constructor and returns a new CheckerBoard
      Returns:
      A new checkers board to start a game

    • getDirection

      static BoardPosition getDirection(DirectionEnum dir)
      A method that takes the given direction and returns a new position
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction of where the BoardPosition should be
      Returns:
      The new BoardPosition that represents movement in the given direction

    • setPieceCount

      void setPieceCount(char player, int numPieces)
      A mutator for the player's piece counts. Updates the piece counts of a player according to the number of pieces they have on a board
      Parameters:
      player - , the character representing the player's pieces, a char
      numPieces - , the number of pieces the player's piece count changes by, an int
